subject: Re: [junit] testing WebStart apps
msgSnippet: ... The biggest difference is the style of writing tests. HTTPUnit centers itself on the protocol, whereas HTMLUnit is more HTML friendly. In HTTPUnit, you
messageBody:
Chappell, Simon P wrote:
> J.B.
>
> > (You mentioned HTTPUnit. If you're not using HTMLUnit, start.)
>
> As I started using HttpUnit this summer, I'm interested in what is it
> that you like about HTMLUnit better?

The biggest difference is the style of writing tests. HTTPUnit centers
itself on the protocol, whereas HTMLUnit is more HTML friendly.

In HTTPUnit, you create requests and send them.

In HTMLUnit, you ask an HtmlPage for HtmlAnchors and click them; or for
HtmlTextInputs and set their values; or for HtmlSubmitInputs and click them.

I find it easier to understand what an HTMLUnit does, because more of
the HTML-ness of the user interaction is part of the tests.

--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
